name: Joseph
description:
What would somebody, just like you, do in their current circumstances, if they were absolutely certain that God was with them?

This one simple question is the backdrop for a quick look at one of the Bible’s most incredible characters.  Joseph’s life is the Biblical record of a man who lived out the answer to that question.

3 CD's

name: Encounter
description:
One moment in God’s Presence can change your life forever.
In this series we look at real people, in everyday life, which met and had an encounter with Jesus. We will discover life-changing truths about God in the conversations and experiences recorded in these actual meetings.

6 CD's

name: Praying Like Jesus
description:
What if you could pray like Jesus?

The Christian bookstores, devotionals, and internet bible study sites are replete with sermons, studies, and series on "How to Pray."  They address the time, place, posture, and frequency of prayer.  Quite honestly, if you start an earnest study of prayer, you may well become quickly overwhelmed, or confused, or both.

Now, prayer isn't by any means a new topic, or an uncommon spiritual discipline to be addressed.  We pretty much all feel like we don't do it often enough, in the right way, or with the right formula.

What if you could pray like Jesus?

4 CD's

name: The Knot
description:
"Let's tie the knot," is a way of saying, that in marriage, two lives are going to become intertwined.  United.  One

But, when you look at a knot, you may see a tangled mess.  Ever try to get a knot out of a string of Christmas lights?  No easy task.

A knot can also be seen as a source of strength and security.  When climbing a sheer rock face, the climber depends on strong, durable knots that won't give away.

This series looks at what scripture has to say about "tying the knot," and how we can allow God to transform marriage into the source of strength rather than a tangled mess.

6 CD's

name: The Goodness of God
description:
God is GOOD.

God's goodness is amazing.  His goodness is far-reaching.

In fact, He is the source of goodness, and therefore, nothing can equal His goodness.

He is "the giver of every good and perfect gift."

God is SO GOOD ... He can't be BAD ... and He can't GET BETTER!

God IS good.

4 CD's

name: Prodigal God
description:
PRODIGAL GOD 
Excessive. Extravagant. Lavish. Abundant.
He fills our cup to overflowing. He opens the windows of heaven and pours out blessings beyond our capacity to receive. He lavishes us with forgiveness and redemption. He does exceedingly, abundantly above and beyond what we can ask or think. 
He IS a Prodigal God.

6 CD's

name: God Is Our Refuge
description:
Where do you go when trouble comes?
That is your refuge.

In the Book of Psalms the place of refuge is pictured as a high, safe place that people could run to when they were anxious, stressed or afraid.  Everyone has one. What is yours?

A refuge is: a shelter in the storm; 
a safe house when pursued;  
a bunker in the battle.

In this series we discover the reality of making God our refuge when the pressures of life close in on us, and the circumstances of life overwhelm us.

5 CD's

name: The Heart of Worship
description:
Worship is love expressed.

Building on that simple definition, this series will help you develop the most significant Biblical expressions of worship.  From the practical; “Why men and women worship differently” to the revelatory; “What are God and Satan’s plans?” you will discover the force and scope of worshiping God from the heart.

6 CD's

name: Wired For Worship
description:
The Father is looking for worshipers.

You are wired for worship.  You can’t help it.  You will worship something or someone.  That being true, you have a choice to make: your life will affect your worship, or your worship will affect your life.

4 CD's

name: You Can Encourage Yourself
description:
You can move beyond the reach of discouragement.

The setting is Ziklag – Satan’s last stand against David’s prophetic destiny. It’s a look at the “worst day in David’s life” and what he did to master the moment and fulfill God’s purposes for his future. 

David’s secrets to overcoming discouragement will help us break the downward pull of our circumstances and struggles. We will learn how to rise above and move beyond the letdowns of life and the influence of others. 

4 CD's

name: 5 Easy Steps To Wreck Your Life
description:
We all have competitors, rivals with God, who wrestle for the throne of our hearts. They push to be the center of attention, the necessary and ultimate focus of our lives. The Bible calls them idols.
 
They relentlessly pursue us, making promises they can’t keep with benefits they can’t produce. And ...none of us are exempt. If you listen to their whispers …they’ll simply wreck your life.

In this series we unmask five contemporary rivals for your heart … and help you avoid the train wreck of a life that they have planned for you.

5 CD's

name: The Battle For Growth
description:
When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I felt as a child, I thought as a child. Now that I have become a man, I have put away childish things.                                                                                                                                  (1 Corinthians 13:11)
The message to us? We begin our walk of faith as children, but we can’t remain children; we’re designed for growth. But growth isn’t easy, enjoyable or inevitable – and it’s opposed at every turn. In fact, there’s a battle for growth. 

Accept the challenge of discipline and you’ll enjoy the rewards of growth!

4 CD's

name: The Word For You Today Devotional (5 copies)
description:
“Word For You Today publishes 16 million devotionals a year in over 20 different languages. It is the fastest growing devotional of its kind and one of the most widely read in the world.”
 
This includes 5 copies of a 1 year subscription mailed quarterly.

Please email for pricing if you would like more than 5 copies.

name: The Word For You Today Devotional
description:
“Word For You Today publishes 16 million devotionals a year in over 20 different languages. It is the fastest growing devotional of its kind and one of the most widely read in the world.”

This includes 1 copy of a 1 year subscription mailed quarterly.

name: Be Strong and Courageous
description:
The focus of this series is to share an encouraging word that will equip you to successfully navigate the changes and challenges of life.

This series takes its text from Joshua 1:9, "Be strong and courageous!  Do not be afraid or discouraged.  For the Lord your God is with you wherever you go."  

Each sermon in this series is crafted to connect you with Biblical reservoirs of strength and courage.

4 CD's

name: Vision - Volume 1
description:
Are you living by sight or vision?

Sight sees things as they are - vision sees things as they can be!

God gave us vision so  we wouldn't be trapped living only by what we see.

Vision creates hope and releases you from the prison of the "now.

4 CD's

Volume 2 is also available.  Please use the contact link to inquire about it.

name: In God We Trust
description:
"It cannot be emphasized too strongly or too often that this great nation was founded, not by religionists, but by Christians.  Not on religion but on the Gospel of Jesus Christ."  Patrick Henry

This series is comprised of four messages that examine the influence of Christianity in the heritage, history and founding of America.

Sermons include:

The Secret of a Blessed Nation
God & Government
The Myth of the Separation of Church & State
Sunday vs. Secularism

4 CD's

name: Unstoppable
description:
There is no biblical basis for being a Christian who is not an involved member of a local church.

Reading the Book of Acts for a biblical history of Christianity we see that the local church is the one way God used to advance the Gospel.  Looking at the New Testament letters we see that they are addressed to local churches or to the pastors of local churches.  

"Upon this rock I will build my church, and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it."  Matthew 16:18

4 CD's

name: You Asked ... We Answer (Part 2)
description:
This series addresses and answers tough questions like:

When should you leave your church?

Can a Christian lose their salvation?

Is it ok to be cremated?

Can every Christian pray in a prayer language?

What's the bible say about drinking alcohol?

4 CD's

name: You Asked ... We Answer (Part 1 - Relationships)
description:
This three-part series is built around answering the tough questions that plague our most intimate relationships.

What are the biblical grounds for divorce?

Is gay marriage wrong?

When should I end a dating relationship?

name: Transition
description:
Transition is, by definition, a process or period in which something undergoes a change and passes from one state, stage, form, or activity to another.

In this series we examine Kingdom principles that will enable us to successfully move from “Here” to “There” in the walk of destiny that God has for our lives.

The book of Joshua is one of the Bible’s most dynamic expressions of transition as Israel moves from the wilderness into the Land of Promise. Their strategies in crossing the Jordan, conquering Jericho and claiming Canaan provide us with powerful truths equipping us to possess our prophetic promises.

5 CD's

name: Forever
description:
You are more than the body you live in. You will outlive your body. You will live forever somewhere. This series is an introductory study of death, eternity, heaven, hell, purgatory, reincarnation, eternal judgment and rewards.

4 CD's

name: Generation and Nations
description: A live recording of an FWC praise and worship concert.

name: Family Worship Center Journals
description: Your choice of softbound or hardbound with pen.

name: Chronological Bible
description: The best-selling One Year Bible, which helps us read the entire Bible in as little as 15 minutes a day. The One Year Bible divides God’s Word into daily readings from the Old Testament, New Testament, Psalms, and Proverbs, creating an achievable, unforgettable devotional experience.
